intro: Eudorus senecioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the spring, and its leaves are narrow and grayish-green in appearance. Eudorus senecioides is adapted to withstand drought conditions and is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements.
